headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; COMMITTEE ON STEAMBOAT LINES. THE BONAPARTE ESTATE. A SPARRING EXHIBITION. COMMISSIONERS OF HEALTH. SUICIDE.

docs.lead_paragraph: A SPARRING EXHIBITION.--On Tuesday even ing there was a large attendance of youths at Kerri ?an's Hall, No. 22 White-street, to witness a set to with the gloves, for the benefit of a young man named BARNEY AARON, who is a favorite among the youthful sports, and as his teacher says, a remarkably prom?ing lad, in the "manly art of self-defence."

headline.main: ONE WEEK LATER FROM EUROPE.; RATE AND IMPORTANT FROM CHINA. Cotton Advanced-Grain Firm-Money Easier Consols 93 1-4 Ex-Dividend. Execution of the Murderer of Mr. Cunningham. The Dispute between Spain and Mexico Still Unsettled. Meeting in Liverpool on the Deficiency of the Cotton Supply. ARRIVAL OF THE PERSIA. OUR LONDON AND PARIS CORRESPONDENCE. The Cable at Birkenhead Completed. Progress of the Atlantic Telegraph Enterprise.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Royal Mail Steamship Persia, from Liverpool about 1 o'clock on the afternoon of Saturday, June 13, arrived here at 7 o'clock yesterday morning. The steamship Asia arrived out at Liverpool at 3 o'clok A. M. on Monday June 8. The screw steamer Queen of the South arrived at Southampton on Wednesday the 10th.
docs.snippet: The Royal Mail Steamship Persia, from Liverpool about 1 o'clock on the afternoon of Saturday, June 13, arrived here at 7 o'clock yesterday morning. The steamship Asia arrived out at Liverpool at 3 o'clok A. M. on Monday June 8. The screw steamer...

docs.lead_paragraph: The Cunard steamship Persia, with one week's later news from Europe, arrived at this port yesterday morning. It is announced that the half of the Atlantic Telegraph cable manufactured by Messrs. R. S. NEWELL Co., at Birkenhead, was completed on the 10th inst. This is the portionwhich will be taken by the Niagara.

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; The Turf for 1857. Corone'rs' Inquests. KILLED ON THE RAILROAD. ANNIVERSARY OF THE ALPHA DELTA PHI SO- SALE OF POWERS' GREEK SLAVE. THE STREETS TO BE CLEANED AT LAST.--

docs.lead_paragraph: After much cogitation, Corporation Counsel BUSTEED has concluded that the City Inspector can proceed to clean the streets without further delay, under the late resolutions of the Common Council, Mr. MORTON yesterday received Mr. BUSTRED's written opinion to that effect, and he promises that he will act upon it immediately.
docs.abstract: City Inspector authorized to have it done

headline.main: The Uiah Rebellion--Why McCaalloch Declined--Matrimontal Argument--The Darien Ship Canal--Affairs with new-Grannda.

docs.lead_paragraph: Again the Governorship of Utah goes begging, ex-Gover or THOMAS, of Maryland, having respect. fully declined it. Rumor assigns the appointment now to three or four other parties,-but Mr. CUM MINGS seems to be most likely to obtain it at this time. If offered to him new it is understood that hewill accept.

headline.main: The Puritans on a Fete Day-The Bunker Hill Celebration and Warren's statue.

docs.lead_paragraph: You will have had a general account of the pro seedings here this week, but may yet find a few notes by a New-Yorker, looking on, acceptable. A New-Yorker in Boston is struck at all times by the simple country-like manner of most people he comes by chance in contact with.
